bug.short_desc: system-config-users doesn't allow assigning an existing group to a new user in the create user dialog

long_desc.thetext: Description of problem: When creating an new user using system-config-users GUI, and I choose "Specify group ID manually:" and enter a gid for an already existing group, then I get the error message dialog "The gid XXXX is already in use." although I have deselected "Create a private group for the user". Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): system-config-users-1.3.6-1.fc21.noarch How reproducible: Always. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Call system-config-users 2. Click on "Add Group" and create a new group. Remember the GID XXXX of this group. 3. Click on "Add User" 4. Fill out the form, deselct "Create a private group for the user", select "Specify user ID manually:" and enter an unused UID, select "Specify group ID manually:" and enter the GID XXXX of the group created in step 2. 5. Click on "Ok". Actual results: Dialog box with the message "The gid XXXX is already in use." (where XXXX is the GID entered in step 4). Expected results: No error message. The user should be created with the default gid XXXX as entered in the form. Additional info: There is a workaround: Create a new user with deselected "Specify group ID manually:" checkbox, and use the remaining values as in the steps described before. This should create a new user with the default group is "users". Then select the new user in the summary, click on "Properties", select the tab "Groups", select the (existing) group that the user should have as default group, and then deselect the group users (the order is important). Then click on "Ok".
